sections.title: Common Questions
content:
Q: Why doesn't this match my exchange quote?
Exchanges add fees and spreads. This tool shows mid-market reference rates refreshed every 30 minutes, so your exchange may differ by a few percent depending on liquidity and fees.

Q: Can I use this for taxes?
Use it only as a starting estimate. Tax filings often require timestamps and source-of-truth records from exchanges or wallets. Always confirm figures with official transaction data.

Q: How many decimals should I trust?
Values are provided up to 8 decimals for precision, but for everyday planning it is best to round to 2-4 decimals to avoid false accuracy.

Q: What about stablecoins?
Stablecoins like USDT or USDC are treated like any other token. Temporary depegs or liquidity gaps may cause slight differences from their intended $1 value.

Q: Does this include historic prices?
The calculator focuses on current snapshot rates. For historical tracking, capture exports regularly or consult dedicated price history tools.
